alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 23 at 2:05PM MST until November 25 at 11:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For heavy snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with isolated higher amounts. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains and Southeastern Otero county * WHEN...From 6 PM Thursday Night through 12 AM MST Friday Night * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A winter storm system will bring significant snow accumulation to the Sacramento Mountains and portions of southeastern Otero County. The highest amounts of snow will be along the eastern slopes fo the Sacramento mountains with up to 8 inches of snow accumulation expected. Surrounding areas may see lesser amounts of snowfall sometimes mixed with rain.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
